entries.title: US alleges Chinese spy balloon flew over sensitive military site
entries.description: US official told reporters the military was prepared to shoot the balloon down but was deterred by potential for harm.

entries.title: India’s Adani’s losses swell above $100bn
entries.description: India's central bank is examining the exposure of banks to the group as its various firms continued to tank.

entries.title: Spain, Morocco seek reset of testy relationship at Rabat summit
entries.description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez says the two countries agreed on a commitment of 'mutual respect'.

entries.title: What’s behind the public anger in the UK?
entries.description: Hundreds of thousands of people have participated in wage strikes.

entries.title: Republicans kick Ilhan Omar off US House foreign affairs panel
entries.description: Muslim-American legislator says her 'voice will get louder and stronger' after vote punishing her criticism of Israel.

entries.title: Putin evokes Stalingrad battle as he vows victory in Ukraine war
entries.description: Putin compared Russia's war in Ukraine with World War II and also lambasted Germany for helping to arm Kyiv.

entries.title: Rape charge against Man United player Greenwood dropped
entries.description: The 21-year-old forward was arrested in January 2022 after images and videos were shared on social media.

entries.title: Guantanamo detainee freed to Belize after 20 years in captivity
entries.description: Majid Khan, who was tortured by the CIA before his transfer to the US military facility in Cuba, says he feels 'reborn'.

entries.title: Israeli attorney general says Netanyahu must avoid legal overhaul
entries.description: Gali Baharav-Miara says the Israeli Cabinet's planned judicial changes risk giving government unbridled power.

entries.title: US filings for jobless aid lowest since April
entries.description: The robust data on the US job market comes even as layoffs in the tech sector have surged.

entries.title: Biden under pressure for police reform after Tyre Nichols funeral
entries.description: US vice president urges Congress to pass legislation as Nichols's death renews push to end violence.

entries.title: Israeli foreign minister in Sudan to discuss ‘normalisation’
entries.description: Sudan's military, in charge since a 2021 coup, is seen as leading the move towards establishing relations with Israel.

entries.title: Serbia to maintain ‘military neutrality’, president says
entries.description: Aleksandar Vucic says 'vital interest' for Serbia to stay on a path to the EU but reiterated it will not join NATO.

entries.title: Aidan McAnespie killing: Ex-UK soldier David Holden avoids jail
entries.description: David Holden handed three-year suspended sentence for manslaughter for the 1988 shooting of Aidan McAnespie.

entries.title: ‘No other place to go’: Migrants living in toxic dump in Chile
entries.description: Chile's Cerro Chuño neighbourhood has become notorious for environmental pollution and dangerous criminal activity.

entries.title: EU’s top brass prepares for summit with Zelenskyy in Kyiv
entries.description: Ukrainian and EU officials will hold talks in Kyiv on Friday over the war-torn country's push to join the bloc.

entries.title: Nigerian communities file damages claim against Shell in UK court
entries.description: The claims say oil spills resulting from Shell's operations in the Niger Delta have endangered the lives of residents.

entries.title: Turkey summons Norwegian ambassador over Quran protest permission
entries.description: Erling Skjonsberg is the latest Western ambassador to be summoned by Turkey over a Quran-related protest.

entries.title: What is behind the rising violent attacks in Pakistan?
entries.description: TTP has denied its role in the Peshawar mosque blast, but officials say it has intensified attacks since November.

entries.title: Pope urges African youth to shun ethnic rivalry and corruption
entries.description: The pontiff addresses more than 65,000 youths in Kinshasa, the capital of the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

entries.title: Middle East round-up: Has the next Intifada already started?
entries.description: Here’s a round-up of Al Jazeera’s Middle East coverage this week.

entries.title: Pakistan mosque bomber wore police uniform: Police chief
entries.description: Pakistani police say the attacker was not checked as forces believed he was one of their own.

entries.title: Italy ‘complicit’ in crimes for renewing pact with Libya: NGOs
entries.description: The Memorandum of Understanding on Migration has been renewed despite mounting evidence of crimes against humanity.

entries.title: Analysis: Ukraine’s new weapon will force a Russian shift
entries.description: Kyiv says longer-range rockets will force Moscow to adapt tactics or face potentially catastrophic losses.

entries.title: India opposition MPs seek Adani probe as group losses top $100bn
entries.description: Opposition MPs call for parliamentary investigation after US-based short seller accuses Adani Group of fraud.

entries.title: Is it too late for the US to contain China?
entries.description: Veteran Singaporean diplomat Kishore Mahbubani says it’s futile for the US to keep trying to 'kneecap' China.

entries.title: Gunmen kill police chief, seven others in central Nigeria
entries.description: The attack is the latest episode of violence before the February 25 presidential and parliamentary elections in Nigeria.

entries.title: Shell profits hit record $40bn as Britons endure inflation
entries.description: UK firm reports highest annual profits in 115-year history, prompting anger among those struggling to pay energy bills.

entries.title: I was nearly lynched in Nigeria. Here’s how I survived
entries.description: What makes my story rare is that I survived. Such is the nature of mob justice in Nigeria that few do.

entries.title: India’s bulldozer regime is evicting Muslims, killing justice
entries.description: Among the often-ignored victims are Assam's Miya Muslims, who have long been wrongly accused of illegal migration.

entries.title: US presses PA to accept plan to quash Palestinian armed groups
entries.description: The US is putting the onus on the Palestinian Authority to improve security in the West Bank, despite Israeli raids.

entries.title: Winter rains revive Iraq’s famed marshlands
entries.description: After years of drought, winter rains have brought some respite to the famous UNESCO World Heritage Site.

entries.title: French forces seize shipment of weapons headed from Iran to Yemen
entries.description: Officials say the seizure, the latest in the water surrounding the Arabian Peninsula, happened in January.

entries.title: Fuel, cash shortages cause fury among Nigerians ahead of election
entries.description: Nigerians are facing petrol shortages and chaos at banks over a new currency swap ahead of elections later this month.

entries.title: Iran blames Israel for Isfahan drone attack
entries.description: Drone attack targeted a military factory in Isfahan on Saturday night, causing minor damage, according to authorities.

entries.title: Siddique Kappan: India journalist walks out of jail after 2 years
entries.description: Siddique Kappan, who spent 28 months in jail, was charged under anti-terror laws for reporting on a gang-rape case.

entries.title: Australia says no place for King Charles III on new A$5 note
entries.description: Central bank says new design will honour 'the culture and history of the First Australians'.

entries.title: Will generative AI change how we live?
entries.description: Generative AI is a new wave of artificial intelligence that supporters say could revolutionise our lives.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 344
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 344th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Israel launches air raids on Gaza after rocket fire
entries.description: Powerful explosions shake buildings and light up night sky as Israel bombs Gaza.

entries.title: N Korea says US drills pushing situation to ‘extreme red-line’
entries.description: Pyongyang threatens 'toughest reaction' to US expanding joint military exercises with South Korea.

entries.title: ‘Symbol of renewal’: US reopens Solomon Islands embassy
entries.description: The US has been stepping up engagement with the Pacific amid concerns about China's influence in the region.

entries.title: Philippines set to allow wider US access to military bases
entries.description: Move comes amid concerns about China's assertiveness in the disputed South China Sea and over self-ruled Taiwan.

entries.title: ‘Riding a rollercoaster’ in Myanmar’s post-coup economy
entries.description: Deepening conflict, sudden changes to regulations and a lack of transparency have made business increasingly hard.
